tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE device_authentication_logs (
  log_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  device_id UUID NOT NULL,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  event_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  user_id UUID,
  success BOOLEAN NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE device_authentication_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT NOT NULL, 
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL, 
    username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
    status VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE unauthorized_access_attempts (
    attempt_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT NOT NULL, 
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL, 
    IP_address VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL, 
    reason VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE DeviceAuthenticationLogs (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(50),
    authentication_status BOOLEAN,
    authentication_time TIMESTAMP,
    authentication_method VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE device_logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  device_id INT,
  event_type VARCHAR(50),
  event_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  event_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE devices (
  device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  device_name VARCHAR(50),
  device_type VARCHAR(50),
  device_owner VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE users (
  user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  username VARCHAR(50),
  email VARCHAR(100),
  password_hash VARCHAR(100),
  registration_date TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE access_attempts (
  attempt_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT,
  device_id INT,
  attempt_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  success BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE authentication_logs (
   log_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
   device_id UUID NOT NULL,
   username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
   authentication_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
   ip_address INET NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE unauthorized_access_attempts (
   attempt_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
   device_id UUID NOT NULL,
   username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
   attempt_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
   failure_reason VARCHAR(100)
);
